{
    "name": "Belinski–Khalatnikov–Lifshitz (BKL) metric",
    "abbrev": "BKLmetric",
    "description": "A simplified, homogeneous and anisotropic model of the universe's evolution, particularly useful for understanding the early universe's dynamics and the onset of singularity formation.",
    "defined": true,
    "derived": false,
    "signature": -1,
    "dimensions": 4,

    "charts": [
        {
            "chartName": "BKL",
            "xlineElement": "ds² = -dt² + t^(2/3)(dx² + dy²) + t^(4/3)dz²",
            "validated": false,
        }
    ],
    "desiredProperties": ["christoffels", "ricci", "riemann", "einstein", "weyl", "g00", "infiniteRedShift", "horizons", "singularities", "limits"],
    "diagrams": []
}[0m
